Notes.Text:
This update for sysstat fixes the following issues:

Security issues fixed:

- CVE-2018-19416: Fixed out-of-bounds read during a memmove call inside the remap_struct function (bsc#1117001).
- CVE-2018-19517: Fixed out-of-bounds read during a memset call inside the remap_struct function (bsc#1117260).
Notes.Title: Details

Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in sysstat 12.1.1. The remap_struct function in sa_common.c has an out-of-bounds read during a memmove call, as demonstrated by sadf.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15:sysstat-12.0.2-3.6.12
SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Server Applications 15:sysstat-12.0.2-3.6.12
SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Server Applications 15:sysstat-isag-12.0.2-3.6.12

Vulnerabilities.Description: An issue was discovered in sysstat 12.1.1. The remap_struct function in sa_common.c has an out-of-bounds read during a memset call, as demonstrated by sadf.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Basesystem 15:sysstat-12.0.2-3.6.12
